content.text: I'll help you implement the highest value item from tasks.md. Let me start by reading the current specifications and reviewing the project structure.

content.content:
1→# V0 MVP Tasks - AI Content Pipeline
     2→
     3→## 🎯 V0 SCOPE: Zoom → YouTube → AI Drafts → Web UI
     4→**Focus**: Turn Zoom recordings into unlisted YouTube videos + 3 AI-generated text drafts (email, X, LinkedIn) with human review/editing UI.
     5→
     6→---
     7→
     8→## 📋 BACKEND TASKS (Python + FastAPI)
     9→
    10→### 1. Core Dependencies & Setup
    11→- [x] Add missing dependencies to `pyproject.toml`:
    12→  - [x] `uvicorn[standard]` (ASGI server)
    13→  - [x] `python-multipart` (file uploads)
    14→  - [x] `httpx` (HTTP client for APIs)
    15→  - [x] `python-dotenv` (environment variables)
    16→  - [x] `supabase` (database client)
    17→  - [x] `google-auth` + `google-auth-oauthlib` (YouTube API)
    18→  - [x] `google-api-python-client` (YouTube upload)
    19→  - [x] `baml-py` (AI client)
    20→- [x] Create `.env` template with required secrets
    21→- [x] Set up basic FastAPI app structure with CORS
    22→- [x] implement all endpoints with no logic, just return dummy data, to get the contract baked so frontend devs can start working, we'll fill in the endpoints as we go
    23→  - [x] `POST /videos/import` - Queue Zoom download
    24→  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}` - Get video details + drafts
    25→  - [x] `POST /videos/{id}/summarize` - Trigger Gemini pipeline
    26→  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}/summary` - Get summary points
    27→  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}/drafts` - List draft history
    28→  - [x] `POST /videos/{id}/drafts` - Save edited drafts
    29→  - [x] `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback` - Add feedback
    30→
    31→### 2. Database Schema & Supabase Setup
    32→- [ ] Create Supabase project
    33→- [ ] Implement database schema (videos, drafts, feedback tables)
    34→- [ ] Set up Supabase client configuration
    35→- [ ] Add RLS policies for user isolation
    36→
    37→### 3. OAuth Integration (for localhost ONLY)
    38→- [ ] Implement Zoom OAuth flow - we'll use a server token from ZOOM_API_KEY and other needed things - consult me when you're ready for these things - output instructions for how to get the key
    39→- [ ] Implement Google/YouTube OAuth flow - just use a google_credentials file that I'll provide, and walk me through the local oauth flow to get the tokens.json file locally, and just store it (use refresh token in the token json before making calls)
    40→
    41→### 4. Core API Endpoints
    42→implement each endpoint one at a time, test with curl
    43→
    44→- [ ] `POST /videos/import` - Queue Zoom download
    45→- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}` - Get video details + drafts
    46→- [ ] `POST /videos/{id}/summarize` - Trigger Gemini pipeline
    47→- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}/summary` - Get summary points
    48→- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}/drafts` - List draft history
    49→- [ ] `POST /videos/{id}/drafts` - Save edited drafts
    50→- [ ] `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback` - Add feedback
    51→
    52→### 5. Video Processing Pipeline
    53→- [ ] Download Zoom recording to backend
    54→- [ ] Upload video to YouTube as unlisted
    55→- [ ] Extract video metadata (title, duration, etc.)
    56→- [ ] Store video info in database
    57→
    58→### 6. AI Integration (BAML)
    59→- [ ] Set up BAML client configuration
    60→- [ ] Create prompt templates for:
    61→  - Video summarization (bullet points)
    62→  - Email draft generation
    63→  - X/Twitter draft generation
    64→  - LinkedIn draft generation
    65→- [ ] Implement Gemini 2.5 Pro integration
    66→- [ ] Add error handling for AI failures
    67→
    68→### 7. Background Processing
    69→- [ ] Implement simple job queue (in-memory or basic file-based)
    70→- [ ] Process one recording at a time
    71→- [ ] Handle job failures gracefully
    72→
    73→---
    74→
    75→## 🎨 FRONTEND TASKS (Next.js + TypeScript)
    76→NOTE THE FRONTEND DOESNT READ FROM TEH BACKEND. IT LISTENS TO THE REALTIME DATABASE BY SUPABASE.
    77→FRONTEND WILL TALK TO BACKEND, but only to request writes.
    78→
    79→### 1. Dependencies & Setup
    80→- [ ] Add missing dependencies:
    81→  - `@supabase/supabase-js` (database client)
    82→  - `@radix-ui/react-*` (shadcn components)
    83→  - `class-variance-authority` (component variants)
    84→  - `clsx` + `tailwind-merge` (styling utilities)
    85→  - `lucide-react` (icons)
    86→  - `@hookform/resolvers` + `react-hook-form` (forms)
    87→  - `zod` (validation)
    88→- [ ] Set up shadcn/ui components
    89→- [ ] Configure biome for linting
    90→- [ ] Set up environment variables
    91→
    92→### 2. Database Integration
    93→- [ ] Configure Supabase client
    94→- [ ] Set up real-time subscriptions
    95→- [ ] Add authentication (basic email/password)
    96→
    97→### 3. Core Pages & Components
    98→- [ ] Dashboard page (`/`) - Video list with status badges
    99→- [ ] Video detail page (`/videos/[id]`) - Player + draft editor
   100→- [ ] Navigation component
   101→- [ ] Video status badges component
   102→- [ ] Draft editor component (textarea with save)
   103→- [ ] Feedback component
   104→
   105→### 4. Video Management UI
   106→- [ ] Import video form (Zoom meeting ID input)
   107→- [ ] Video list table with:
   108→  - Status indicators
   109→  - Title/duration
   110→  - Created date
   111→  - Action buttons
   112→- [ ] Video detail view with:
   113→  - Embedded YouTube player
   114→  - Summary points display
   115→  - Draft editing interface
   116→
   117→### 5. Draft Editing Interface
   118→- [ ] Three textarea fields (Email, X, LinkedIn)
   119→- [ ] Pre-fill with AI-generated content
   120→- [ ] Inline editing with save functionality
   121→- [ ] Version history display
   122→- [ ] Feedback input form
   123→
   124→### 6. Real-time Updates
   125→- [ ] Subscribe to video status changes
   126→- [ ] Auto-refresh when drafts are updated
   127→- [ ] Loading states for all async operations
   128→
   129→---
   130→
   131→## 🔧 INTEGRATION TASKS
   132→
   133→### 1. API Integration
   134→- [ ] Create TypeScript types for all API responses
   135→- [ ] Implement API client functions
   136→- [ ] Add error handling for API calls
   137→- [ ] Add loading states for all operations
   138→
   139→### 2. Environment Setup
   140→- [ ] Create `.env.local` for frontend secrets
   141→- [ ] Create `.env` for backend secrets
   142→- [ ] Document all required environment variables
   143→
   144→### 3. Development Workflow
   145→- [ ] Set up hot reload for both frontend/backend
   146→- [ ] Add basic error logging
   147→- [ ] Test OAuth flows end-to-end
   148→- [ ] Test video upload pipeline
   149→
   150→---
   151→
   152→## 🚫 OUT OF SCOPE (V0)
   153→- CI/CD pipelines
   154→- Advanced analytics
   155→- Rich WYSIWYG editors
   156→- Auto-publishing to social media
   157→- Scheduling functionality
   158→- Advanced job queues
   159→- Complex retry logic
   160→- Performance optimizations
   161→- Advanced security features
   162→
   163→---
   164→
   165→## 🎯 SUCCESS CRITERIA
   166→1. User can import Zoom recording via meeting ID
   167→2. Video appears on YouTube as unlisted
   168→3. AI generates 3 draft texts (email, X, LinkedIn)
   169→4. User can edit drafts in web UI
   170→5. All changes persist to database
   171→6. Real-time updates work
   172→7. Basic error handling in place
   173→
   174→---
   175→
   176→## 📝 NOTES
   177→- Keep it simple - this is a hackathon project
   178→- Focus on core functionality over polish
   179→- Use existing libraries and tools
   180→- Test manually rather than automated tests
   181→- Deploy to local development only

</system-reminder>

1→# Automated Video Summarization & Draft Distribution – **V0 Specification**
     2→
     3→> **Focus**: Build the thinnest slice that turns a Zoom cloud recording into (1) an unlisted YouTube video and (2) three AI‑generated text drafts (email, X, LinkedIn) that a human can review and edit inside a single web UI. **No auto‑publishing, scheduling, or advanced analytics in V0.**
     4→
     5→---
     6→
     7→## 1 Scope
     8→
     9→| In‑scope (V0 MVP)                                                                 | Out‑of‑scope (deferred)                |
    10→| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
    11→| • OAuth connections for Zoom & Google (YouTube)                                   | X / LinkedIn OAuth & direct publishing |
    12→| • Download Zoom recording to backend                                              | Rich WYSIWYG editor, comment threads   |
    13→| • Upload video to YouTube as *Unlisted*                                           | Metrics, analytics, dashboards         |
    14→| • Send video URL to Gemini 2.5 Pro → get \`\`                                     | Auto‑transcription outside Gemini      |
    15→| • Generate email / X / LinkedIn copy via prompt template                          | Prompt designer UI, multiple templates |
    16→| • Persist artefacts & status in Supabase                                          | Job retries UI, observability stack    |
    17→| • Next.js UI: list videos, display draft text fields, allow inline edits & "Save" | “Approve & publish”, scheduling flows  |
    18→
    19→---
    20→
    21→## 2 Architecture Snapshot (V0)
    22→
    23→```
    24→Zoom  ──► FastAPI backend ──► YouTube (unlisted)
    25→                   │
    26→                   └─► Gemini 2.5 Pro ──► summary_points
    27→                                     │
    28→Supabase  ◀────────┴─ store video & drafts
    29→    ▲
    30→    │  realtime
    31→Next.js UI  ◀──────────────────────────────
    32→```
    33→
    34→* **Backend** (Python 3.12 + FastAPI) handles Zoom → YouTube → Gemini pipeline.
    35→* **Database**: Supabase Postgres; tables: `videos`, `drafts`.
    36→* **Frontend** (Next.js 14, TypeScript) subscribes to Supabase to live‑refresh UI.
    37→
    38→---
    39→
    40→## 3 Data Model (updated for summary + feedback)
    41→
    42→```sql
    43→-- videos (one row per recording)
    44→CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');
    45→CREATE TABLE videos (
    46→  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    47→  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
    48→  youtube_video_id text,
    49→  transcript jsonb NOT NULL,
    50→  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
    51→  title text,
    52→  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
    53→  points jsonb,          -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
    54→);
    55→
    56→-- drafts (versioned per channel)
    57→CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');
    58→CREATE TABLE drafts (
    59→  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    60→  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    61→  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
    62→  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
    63→  content text NOT NULL,
    64→  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
    65→  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
    66→);
    67→CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);
    68→
    69→-- feedback on individual draft versions
    70→CREATE TABLE feedback (
    71→  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    72→  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    73→  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
    74→  body text NOT NULL,
    75→  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
    76→);
    77→```
    78→
    79→---
    80→
    81→## 4 Key API Endpoints (Backend → Frontend)
    82→
    83→| Method                                 | Path                                                                                                  | Purpose |
    84→| -------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
    85→| `POST /videos/import`                  | Body: `{zoom_meeting_id}` → queues download job; returns `{video_id}`                                 |         |
    86→| `GET  /videos/{id}`                    | Returns Video DTO incl. latest summary & current drafts                                               |         |
    87→| `POST /videos/{id}/summarize`          | Triggers Gemini pipeline; creates `summary` row + first‑gen drafts                                    |         |
    88→| `GET  /videos/{id}/summary`            | Returns persisted `summary_points` JSON                                                               |         |
    89→| `GET  /videos/{id}/drafts?channel={c}` | List draft history (ordered by `version`)                                                             |         |
    90→| `POST /video/{id}/drafts`              | Body: `{content}`  + `{channel}` →  adds new content with next version number, sets `generated=false` |         |
    91→| `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback`           | Body: `{body}` → create feedback row + create a new draft (version++)                                 |         |
    92→|                                        |                                                                                                       |         |
    93→
    94→All DTOs generated via **pydantic** and served through FastAPI’s OpenAPI schema.
    95→
    96→---
    97→
    98→## 5 UI Flow (Next.js)
    99→
   100→1. **Dashboard** – table of recordings (status badges).
   101→2. **Detail Page** – left: embedded YouTube player; right: three textarea fields pre‑filled with AI drafts.
   102→
   103→   1. **Save** button persists updates to `drafts` table via RPC.
   104→   2. Feedback section
   105→
   106→*(No approval/publish buttons in V0)*
   107→
   108→---
   109→
   110→## 6 Non‑Functional Targets
   111→
   112→DO NOT DO ANY OF THESE ACTION YET UNLESS SPECIFICALLY TOLD TO.
   113→
   114→* **Throughput**: one recording processed at a time; queue depth ≤10 acceptable.
   115→* **Latency**: ≤10 min from import to drafts (network & Gemini latency bound).
   116→* **Security**: Supabase RLS — users can only see their own rows. Secrets in env vars.
   117→* **CI**: lint + unit tests; deploy backend to Fly.io, frontend to Vercel.
   118→
   119→---
   120→
   121→---
   122→
   123→## Stack Guidelines
   124→
   125→- Frontend - ONLY USE NPX and NPM. Use React and nextjs, use shadcn ONLY for ui components, biomejs for linting
   126→- Python - ONLY USE UV and UVX - not pip, not pipx, not poetry
   127→- AI - Use BAML
   128→
   129→
   130→

</system-reminder>

content.text: The files do not appear malicious - they seem to be a legitimate development project for an AI content pipeline application. Let me review the current backend implementation to understand what's already been done:

content.content:
1→from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException, status
     2→from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
     3→from typing import List, Optional
     4→import uuid
     5→from datetime import datetime
     6→import os
     7→from dotenv import load_dotenv
     8→
     9→from models import (
    10→    VideoImportRequest, DraftUpdateRequest, FeedbackRequest,
    11→    Video, Draft, Feedback,
    12→    VideoImportResponse, VideoResponse, SummaryResponse, 
    13→    DraftsListResponse, DraftSaveResponse, FeedbackResponse, StatusResponse,
    14→    ZoomRecordingsResponse, ZoomRecording,
    15→    ZoomMeetingRecordings, ZoomMeetingsResponse
    16→)
    17→from database import db
    18→from zoom_client import zoom_client
    19→
    20→# Load environment variables
    21→load_dotenv()
    22→
    23→app = FastAPI(title="AI Content Pipeline API", version="1.0.0")
    24→
    25→# CORS middleware
    26→app.add_middleware(
    27→    CORSMiddleware,
    28→    allow_origins=["http://localhost:3000"],  # Frontend URL
    29→    allow_credentials=True,
    30→    allow_methods=["*"],
    31→    allow_headers=["*"],
    32→)
    33→
    34→
    35→# Validate required environment variables
    36→required_env_vars = ["SUPABASE_URL", "SUPABASE_ANON_KEY"]
    37→for var in required_env_vars:
    38→    if not os.getenv(var):
    39→        print(f"WARNING: {var} environment variable not set")
    40→
    41→@app.get("/")
    42→async def root():
    43→    return {"message": "AI Content Pipeline API"}
    44→
    45→@app.post("/videos/import", status_code=status.HTTP_202_ACCEPTED, response_model=VideoImportResponse)
    46→async def import_video(request: VideoImportRequest):
    47→    """Queue Zoom download - returns video ID immediately"""
    48→    video_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    49→    
    50→    # Create video record
    51→    video = Video(
    52→        id=video_id,
    53→        title=f"Zoom Meeting {request.zoom_meeting_id}",
    54→        duration=3600,  # 1 hour
    55→        status="processing",
    56→        created_at=datetime.now()
    57→    )
    58→    
    59→    try:
    60→        await db.create_video(video)
    61→        return VideoImportResponse(video_id=video_id, status="queued")
    62→    except Exception as e:
    63→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
    64→
    65→@app.get("/videos/{video_id}", response_model=VideoResponse)
    66→async def get_video(video_id: str):
    67→    """Get video details + drafts"""
    68→    try:
    69→        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
    70→        if not video:
    71→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
    72→        
    73→        video_drafts = await db.get_drafts_by_video(video_id)
    74→        return VideoResponse(video=video, drafts=video_drafts)
    75→    except HTTPException:
    76→        raise
    77→    except Exception as e:
    78→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
    79→
    80→@app.post("/videos/{video_id}/summarize", status_code=status.HTTP_202_ACCEPTED, response_model=StatusResponse)
    81→async def trigger_summarize(video_id: str):
    82→    """Trigger Gemini pipeline"""
    83→    try:
    84→        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
    85→        if not video:
    86→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
    87→        
    88→        # Simulate processing - update status and add sample summary points
    89→        updates = {
    90→            "status": "processing",
    91→            "summary_points": [
    92→                "Key point 1: Introduction to AI content pipeline",
    93→                "Key point 2: Benefits of automated content generation",
    94→                "Key point 3: Best practices for implementation"
    95→            ]
    96→        }
    97→        
    98→        await db.update_video(video_id, updates)
    99→        return StatusResponse(status="summarization started")
   100→    except HTTPException:
   101→        raise
   102→    except Exception as e:
   103→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   104→
   105→@app.get("/videos/{video_id}/summary", response_model=SummaryResponse)
   106→async def get_summary(video_id: str):
   107→    """Get summary points"""
   108→    try:
   109→        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   110→        if not video:
   111→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   112→        
   113→        return SummaryResponse(summary_points=video.summary_points or [])
   114→    except HTTPException:
   115→        raise
   116→    except Exception as e:
   117→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   118→
   119→@app.get("/videos/{video_id}/drafts", response_model=DraftsListResponse)
   120→async def list_drafts(video_id: str):
   121→    """List draft history"""
   122→    try:
   123→        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   124→        if not video:
   125→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   126→        
   127→        video_drafts = await db.get_drafts_by_video(video_id)
   128→        return DraftsListResponse(drafts=video_drafts)
   129→    except HTTPException:
   130→        raise
   131→    except Exception as e:
   132→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   133→
   134→@app.post("/videos/{video_id}/drafts", response_model=DraftSaveResponse)
   135→async def save_drafts(video_id: str, request: DraftUpdateRequest):
   136→    """Save edited drafts"""
   137→    try:
   138→        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   139→        if not video:
   140→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   141→        
   142→        draft_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
   143→        
   144→        # Create new draft
   145→        draft = Draft(
   146→            id=draft_id,
   147→            video_id=video_id,
   148→            email_content=request.email_content,
   149→            x_content=request.x_content,
   150→            linkedin_content=request.linkedin_content,
   151→            created_at=datetime.now(),
   152→            version=1
   153→        )
   154→        
   155→        await db.create_draft(draft)
   156→        return DraftSaveResponse(draft_id=draft_id, status="saved")
   157→    except HTTPException:
   158→        raise
   159→    except Exception as e:
   160→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   161→
   162→@app.post("/drafts/{draft_id}/feedback", response_model=FeedbackResponse)
   163→async def add_feedback(draft_id: str, request: FeedbackRequest):
   164→    """Add feedback"""
   165→    try:
   166→        draft = await db.get_draft(draft_id)
   167→        if not draft:
   168→            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Draft not found")
   169→        
   170→        feedback_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
   171→        
   172→        feedback = Feedback(
   173→            id=feedback_id,
   174→            draft_id=draft_id,
   175→            content=request.content,
   176→            created_at=datetime.now()
   177→        )
   178→        
   179→        await db.create_feedback(feedback)
   180→        return FeedbackResponse(feedback_id=feedback_id, status="added")
   181→    except HTTPException:
   182→        raise
   183→    except Exception as e:
   184→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   185→
   186→@app.get("/test/supabase")
   187→async def test_supabase():
   188→    """Test Supabase connection and credentials"""
   189→    try:
   190→        # Simple connection test
   191→        from database import db
   192→        # Try a basic operation
   193→        return {"status": "connected", "message": "Supabase credentials valid"}
   194→    except Exception as e:
   195→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, 
   196→                          detail=f"Supabase connection failed: {str(e)}")
   197→
   198→@app.get("/test/zoom")  
   199→async def test_zoom():
   200→    """Test Zoom API credentials"""
   201→    zoom_api_key = os.getenv("ZOOM_API_KEY")
   202→    zoom_api_secret = os.getenv("ZOOM_API_SECRET")
   203→    
   204→    if not zoom_api_key or not zoom_api_secret:
   205→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   206→                          detail="Zoom API credentials not configured")
   207→    
   208→    try:
   209→        # Simple credentials validation
   210→        return {"status": "configured", "message": "Zoom API credentials found"}
   211→    except Exception as e:
   212→        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   213→                          detail=f"Zoom API test failed: {str(e)}")
   214→
   215→@app.get("/zoom/recordings", response_model=ZoomMeetingsResponse)
   216→async def get_zoom_recordings(
   217→    from_date: Optional[str] = None,
   218→    to_date: Optional[str] = None,
   219→    user_id: str = "me"
   220→):
   221→    """Fetch existing Zoom recordings, grouped by meeting"""
   222→    try:
   223→        recordings_data = zoom_client.get_recordings(
   224→            user_id=user_id,
   225→            from_date=from_date,
   226→            to_date=to_date
   227→        )
   228→        # Group by meeting_id
   229→        meetings = {}
   230→        for rec in recordings_data:
   231→            m_id = rec["meeting_id"]
   232→            if m_id not in meetings:
   233→                meetings[m_id] = {
   234→                    "meeting_id": m_id,
   235→                    "meeting_title": rec["meeting_title"],
   236→                    "recording_start": rec["recording_start"],
   237→                    "recording_end": rec["recording_end"],
   238→                    "recordings": []
   239→                }
   240→            meetings[m_id]["recordings"].append(ZoomRecording(**rec))
   241→        meetings_list = [ZoomMeetingRecordings(**m) for m in meetings.values()]
   242→        return ZoomMeetingsResponse(
   243→            meetings=meetings_list,
   244→            total_count=len(meetings_list)
   245→        )
   246→    except Exception as e:
   247→        raise HTTPException(
   248→            status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   249→            detail=f"Failed to fetch Zoom recordings: {str(e)}"
   250→        )
   251→
   252→if __name__ == "__main__":
   253→    import uvicorn
   254→    port = int(os.getenv("PORT", 8000))
   255→    uvicorn.run("main:app", host="0.0.0.0", port=port, reload=True)

input.content:
-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

  transcript jsonb,

  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)

-- Feedback on individual draft versions

-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

  - plan-ai-integration-agent.md

input.content:
-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

- Draft should have: id, video_id, channel (enum), version, content, generated (bool), created_at
